channel.title: Could not save for player
channel.description:
[code]---Project16 V.6 by Wolf |-Enabled-| --- ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:3937 tester is signing onto server. Could not save for tester ClientHandler: Client tester disconnected. ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:3938 tester is signing onto server. [client-1-tester]: playerCommand: pitsroom Could not save for tester ClientHandler: Client tester disconnected. [/code]
As you can see I am using Project 16 v6.. I was just wondering how I could make it so that the player would save if s/he were to disconnect. I have already tried to add the current default save which is savechar() and savemoreinfo() to public void logout, But it still wouldn't save??
Thanks, LKCTheReturn

item.title: Could not save for player
item.dc:creator: @LKCTheReturn LKCTheReturn
item.description:
@LKCTheReturn wrote:

I am using servabase client.
But in the logout void before I edited it… it only had

outStream.createFrame(109);

btw it is Proj 16 v6…

Read full topic

item.title: Could not save for player
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

what type of client are you using to log on with? I think it is thinking your an attempted flood so disconnects you and doesn’t save your profile.

Read full topic
